respectful
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear

king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great

Grand Prince Yixin (1833-1898), sixth son of Emperor Daoguang, prominent politician, diplomat and modernizer in late Qing

sentences.english: The third interpretation attributes the practice to Fu Jin, the Princes of Gong of the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 第三種解釋跟清朝的恭親王福晉有關。

sentences.english: Prince Gong, Yixin, was the sixth son of Emperor Daoguan.
sentences.chinese: 恭親王奕★是道光皇帝的第六個兒子。

sentences.english: In the 1930s, the palace was bought by Furen Catholic University.
sentences.chinese: 二十世紀三十年代，恭親王府被輔仁大學買下辦學。

sentences.english: Yu prince blessing entire Hongs in a hurry, the respectful prince often preferably also immediately went.
sentences.chinese: 裕親王福全薨了沒多久，恭親王常寧也隨之去了。

definition: Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
talented field commander (military)
Zhu Qizhen, personal name of sixth and eighth Ming emperor Zhengtong 正統|正统[Zheng4 tong3], afterwards Tianshun Emperor 天順|天顺[Tian1 shun4] (1427-1464), reigned 1435-1449 and 1457-1464
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)

strictly impartial and incorruptible (idiom)
to prepare for a funeral
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
Dorgon (1612-1651), fourteenth son of Nurhaci 努爾哈赤|努尔哈赤, successful general, instrumental in Manchu conquest of China, ruled China as regent 1644-1650 for his nephew Emperor Shunzhi 順治帝
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
Nurhaci (1559-1626), founder and first Khan of the Manchu Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金 (from 1616)
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
